title: Our dose of Ezreal came early this year
body:
Seems Ezreal already fulfilled his quota of finding something annoying to abuse to become OP this season.

Does that mean we're getting a double dose of Ezreal this season? There is no way he can go an entire year without finding something else to break.

Extremely unlikely to happen. Ezreal is consistently among the most popular champions in the game, his playrate only dropping below 10% when he was BY FAR the worst ADC out there, reworking him would be as much risk for Riot as reworking Le Song or Riven.

On the other hand, his ban rate tends to be super-low unless he is completely broken like right now or in early season 7, clearly indicating that majority of the playerbase doesn't mind playing against him unless he is by far too strong (compare to champs like Zed who's banrate didn't drop below 20% even when he was supposedly garbage).

While Ez often "breaks" something, causing a lot of whining on boards, long-term statistics clearly show that he is among best designs in the game - fun for the player, but fair and non-toxic for the enemies. Riot won't give up on that.

Yeah, even I as an Ez main will admit that he’s in definite need of a rework. I personally would like to see his W get reworked, though I did kinda have an idea to “balance” his Q...

Instead of proccing on-hit effects outright, what if they made on-hit and crit proc on his Q, but only at 50% effectiveness?

I don't think that he needs a rework but riot has said that they would be willing to look into reworking his w into something more useful. I think that Ez "breaking an item" every year is somewhat of an overstatement. He normally abuses one item with his q because it is a unique ability for about a patch but then riot normally responds by fixing it (as they did in the case of muramana) but in this kleptomancy case i really dont see a problem with it on him. Is it strong? yes. But honestly I don't feel like it gives him a free win ever. It just works really well on him. I think they might tone it down a bit and maybe add a charge system to kleptomancy similarly to how spellthiefs is but other than that i don't foresee much changing. I actually just played a game with Klepto Ez, and I’m now even more convinced that it’s Klepto for two big reasons: Utility and Gold Efficiency.

Okay, so Ez is a decent/good early game champ that shines in the mid game. Klepto pretty much injects Ezreal’s early game with steroids. You’re not just getting gold. You get so much more:

-Even more gold (RNG gold sacks, which can be sold for 65g each).
-Health and Mana pots (you know, those blue pots that got removed because they were broken).
-Free wards and control wards (which don’t count against your ward total, meaning it’s even harder to gank the lane).
-ELIXIRS (both old and new. I don’t even understand how this was considered a good idea in ANY CONTEXT. This literally means you are guaranteed to get free stats in lane).

This not only allows Ezreal to viably start without offensive items (I always start with mana crystal anyways, but this makes that start much easier), but it shoots the gold efficiency of ANY character with this mastery through the roof because you get free stats that your opponent can’t really deny unless they perfectly zone you out.

I totally agree now that Klepto needs to either have a significantly reduced drop rate, or they need to take elixirs and other items that aren’t currently available to buy out of the drop roulette.

yea i see your point. Ive played it a few times i still am in the minority. I never feel like i am dominating the opposing laner ever. I really think its just a cool interaction that people are completely blowing out of proportion. Why do i think he has a high winrate. Because of those rng gold sacks that give way to much gold. every time i use one i normally get toward the upper end of the amount of gold given. That lets ezreal get his items much faster like normally when i first back with ezreal i get tear and maybe boots and a pot. But now I tend to (if i get a kill bot lane which normally happens) i get tear and sheen. After first back is supposed to be ezreals weakest point in laning and early game since he has to buy tear but since i can get sheen as well it bridges that time period where he is weakest allowing him to get to his power spike safer than before and stronger. 

My solution: Either get rid of gold sacks or make it so that they just give you ~65 gold when you use them (their selling price) I think that would drastically solve this problem since you already get gold for hitting champions as well.

Let's face it, he spent his fair share of time in the garbage tier.

When exactly? I am playing this game since season 3 ad Ez was newer considered trash tier. He was either God tier or almost tier 1. He was always a perfectly viable safe pick that works well in pretty much every team comp duo to the natyre and safety of his kit. Long range poke, enough burst, decent sustained dmg, inbuilt flash, global ultimate, insanely good kiting potential, can play 3 roles (mid, adc, jungle). Tell me exactly when was he considered trash tier? 

Trash tier are high risk low reward and high risk bad reward champions, even some high risk high reward champions depending on meta. For example, current Kindred is trash tier HIGH RISK - MEDIUM REWARD champion with terribly designed passive that puts her in risk to counterjungle while being way too weak for counterjungling and yet, her overall damage depends on that passive way too much. Kindred is strong as hell if she gets 10+ stacks but that simply happens in 1 out of 10 games if she's lucky. Difference between 10+ stacks Kindred and 5 stacks Kindred is like Nasus with 100 and 700 stacks on his Q. Got the point? Other example would be Kartus, hes even worse than Kindred as he is currently HIGH RISK - ALMOST NO REWARD.
Inbuilt flash with a bigger range and a targeted high base damage bolt, may I add.
Aaaand really annoying appearance on top all of that.

Ezreal has almost never been garbage.  He breaks items and then goes back to sitting on an average winrate.  Then when the time is right, he crawls back into the game to break something.  This isn't a new development.
Maybe he wasn't underperforming, but he was almost as invisible as Jhin was back in the Ardent meta, in my personal experience

Back then he wasn't an ADC... He was a jungler. Ardent didnt need to be strong on him, he could just kite the jungle and technically gank halfway across the map with his ult, while going botlane and pressuring range while having an incredibly safe escape, and strong AD scalings. He was practically the most safe clear jungler because he could kite the jungle with ease, and where graves does suffer damage, ezreal almost nullifies it once he has a few items.

I saw how terrifying his ganks and early invade were a few times here and there but it didn't really bother me because he was almost banned every game, unless he had a low pick rate at that time which I doubt
"Ezreal breaks item every year"  - broke last item in season 4 and before that in season 2. Legit logic. Next post - better nerf Irelia...
